reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at the New Miyako Hotel from April 16th to the 19th. We booked our trip through Traveolicity and got an amazing rate. I was expecting that we would get one of the older rooms as a result but instead we got one of the newly renovated rooms on the 6th (top) floor. I think the key to getting one of the newer rooms is to arrive as close to 1:00 as possible, when they start checking people in. We arrived around 1:15 and got a beautiful room. The renovated rooms really are as pretty as they appear on their website. It was clean and there were tons of great amenities. The beds are probably hard compared to western beds, but we found them to be very comfortable with fluffy duvets. The bathroom was small, but we took comfortable baths everynight after long days of sightseeing. The rooms are very quiet and we never heard anyone in the hall ways through the door or the walls. The location was great, as others have mentioned. We ate regularly at the restaurants in the station. Skip breakfast at the hotel and run over to the bakeries on the first floor of the station. The breakfast at the hotel was overpriced and not that impressive. Dessert though was delicious at the hotel. As a treat, on the last night, we had cakes at one of the restaurants that was to die for. If you like Japanese sweets, try the Ne ne. I'm still drooling over it!
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.disliked: — Trouble getting access to computers due to long waits at night

reviews.text: We had no choice but to stay at the New Miyako Hotel as part of the Sunrise Tours package (hotel and bullet train tickets) since that was the only option left. Both of us were quite wary of the hotel since (thankfully) we read a prior review on Tripadvisor which warned of bed bugs in the room. Once we checked in (which was a nightmare in it of itself), we immediately pulled the bed out to investigate and discovered several dead bed bugs near the base of the headboard and on the sheets.
reviews.title: Beware of the BED BUGS

reviews.text: Upon seeing the dead insects, we rushed downstairs to check Tripadvisor for another place and immediately booked Aranvert Hotel for that very night (which was only $120/night). Aranvert was located in a much better location (within walking distance to the Gion district) and extremely clean.

reviews.text: We stayed at the New Miyako Hotel for several nights in a moderate sized room in the remodeled south wing and we really enjoyed our stay. The room looked exactly like the photos on the hotel web-site. Our room was very clean and the staff curteous and responsive. The bathroom was stocked with all the toiletries you need - toothbrush & toothpaste, razor, shaving cream, bath sponge, etc... It's conveniently located across the street from the Kyoto train station and is an easy walk. We didn't try any of the restaurants in the hotel -- there were too many dining options at Kyoto station, including the floors of prepared foods from the Itsen department store. Our tour book suggested that any location in Kyoto is convenient due to the extensive bus system, but the buses can be crowded and dragging your luggage onto a bus can't be fun. For convenience of getting in and out of Kyoto, I'd recommend staying near the station. Getting around Kyoto on their bus system wasn't a problem (though I recommend getting a bus map from the tourist office in Kyoto station). There's also a main post office at the station, so it's easy to get cash. There is currently construction in the lot next to the hotel, so some of the rooms facing the right side of the hotel may be noisy.

Located across from the station but did not hear the trains. Hotel has 3 great restaurants but the porto area in the basement of the shopping centre is the best choice.
